intro: Diplotaxis erucastrum proles stenocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruited erucaceous cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and linear, hairy leaves. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The fruit is a slender silique, which is a type of dry, dehiscent fruit typical of the Brassicaceae family.
